intro: Cryptantha jamesii var. pustulosa, commonly known as the pustulate cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, mat-like growth form. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This variety is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
